sentences.sContent: Kennedy exhorted his listeners to turn away from violence.
sentences.sCn: 肯尼迪劝告他的听众要远离暴力。

sentences.sContent: He exhorted his companions, "Try to accomplish your aim with diligence."
sentences.sCn: 他勉励他的同志，“尝试以勤奋来实现目标。”

remMethod.val: ex(表加强) + hort(催促) → 强烈地催促 → 劝告， 规劝， 告诫

trans.tranCn: 劝告， 规劝， 告诫
trans.tranOther: If you exhort someone to do something, you try hard to persuade or encourage them to do it
